name: Vessels for the Future Research Association
goal:
WHO WE ARE
Vessels for the Future comprises a leading group of maritime stakeholders with a common interest in the development of advanced waterborne technologies, who want to ensure that the maritime industry has a strong and vibrant future and remains competitive in the global market.
OBJECTIVE
To make shipping safer, cleaner and more efficient and to strengthen European industrial competitiveness in the maritime sector through co-funded research and embracing the EU priorities of Blue Growth and Transport Modal Shift in the research.
HOW
The Association will promote the case to secure European funding in maritime research through the Horizon 2020 programme and to establish a Public Private Partnership with the EU. It will achieve this through an influencing role and by agreeing and communicating technological development priorities across its membership and with the European Commission.
GOALS
Safer Maritime Transport; Ships that are as safe as equivalent land based assets, Safety Target: risk reduction 90%
Clearer more Efficient Marine Transport; Ships that are more fuel efficient, support the blue economy and modal transport shift, ECO Targets: CO2 emissions reduction 80%, NOx and SOx reduction 100%, underwater noise level reduction 10dB.
A Competitive Industry that creates new jobs; Ship design, systems development and production leadership,
Competitiveness Targets: technology supplier productivity improvement 80%, and ship operating costs reduction 80%
interests: Climate Action, Education, Enterprise, Environment, Research and Technology, Transport
euInitiatives:
Maritime Research calls under EU Horizon 2020 Work Programme.

Research funding through EU cPPP's constituted under Article 187.
